oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Program for "Meet The Wife," a play presented by The Little Theatre Guild, 1928 May
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Little Theatre Guild, under the direction of Ramon Savich, presented the play "Meet The Wife" by Lynn Starling on May 23-26, 1928, at the Hillsboro Theatre, 2101 Belcourt Avenue, Nashville, Tennessee. It was the last offering by the company for their 1927-28 season. It received rave reviews for principals Madge West Joseph, Dr. H. B. Schermerhorn and cast. The program is printed with black ink on cream colored paper and consists of a cover and six pages. Taken from a pen and ink or woodblock print, it has a possible artist's name, Cornelia Park, in the lower right hand corner. It includes Guild board, director, cast and play information, interspersed with ads for local businesses. Forms part of the Madge West Joseph Scrapbooks. 1 program: b & w; 6 x 9 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Joseph, Madge West, 1892-1985--Performances; Schermerhorn, Holden Bovie, 1868-1935--Performances
